headline: Hilton’s Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Hilton’s fourth quarter results reflected a combination of robust international demand, steady group bookings, and continued cost discipline, helping the company surpass Wall Street’s revenue and profit expectations. Management credited strength in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) markets as well as growth in leisure and group segments for offsetting softer performance in the U.S. CEO Christopher Nassetta highlighted, “System-wide RevPAR increased 50 basis points year over year.
